channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Tell us more Mikhail Antonov What is the intent here? Ain't HCI going away?

stack you meant - HConnectionManager is going away? HCI is the main implementation of connection (and cluster connection) as of now, not sure it can go away. HCI might be renamed to just ConnectionImplementation though.

My intent here was actually to decouple the connection impl from connection manager (this class seems a bit overloaded), thinking that eventually we would only have several connection interfaces (base and derived, like ClusterConnection), connection factory to create connections, and ConnectionManager might go away. Do you think that's wrong direction?

My bad. You are going in the right direction. Please ignore my comment above.

Aside: A class named HCI is just too ugly to reveal as a public top-level class (smile). It would be interface private I presume? Could be CI so you get a bit of a green field when cleaning up.
Yep, I think it would definitely be interface private (unless someone could suggest why it shouldn't). Thinking the rename would be good too.
Draft patch (will weed out some nits in next one)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12704896/HBASE-13248.patch
against master branch at commit dc03942ed1f2839332782995fdae5032e67fe1e7.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12704896

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 51 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 1927 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 1917 errors).

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ String key = getStubKey(ClientProtos.ClientService.BlockingInterface.class.getName(), sn.getHostname(),
+ public MasterProtos.AddColumnResponse addColumn(RpcController controller, MasterProtos.AddColumnRequest request)
+ RpcController controller, MasterProtos.CreateNamespaceRequest request) throws ServiceException {
+ RpcController controller, MasterProtos.DeleteNamespaceRequest request) throws ServiceException {
+ public MasterProtos.GetNamespaceDescriptorResponse getNamespaceDescriptor(RpcController controller,
+ public MasterProtos.ListNamespaceDescriptorsResponse listNamespaceDescriptors(RpcController controller,
+ * @deprecated since 0.96 - Use

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HTableInterface#batch}

instead
+ * @deprecated since 0.96 - Use

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HTable#processBatchCallback}

instead
+ * below will ensure that this

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnection}

instance is cleaned up.
+ * @deprecated Use

{@link org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.Admin#getTableDescriptorsByTableName(java.util.List)}

instead

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/13272//testReport/

This message is automatically generated.
Hm. I guess most of checkstyle/long line warnings are caused by simply moving existing stuff around..Something to fix or..?

Mikhail Antonov You reviewed checkstyle, and you can't see anything obviously caused by this patch? If so, ok. Skimmed. You were going to call HCI CI? It is missing private annotation? We are returning HTableInterface rather than Table. Is fixing this for another patch? (this issue is just about the moving HCI out of HCM? If so, that is fine. Patch LGTM.
@stack thanks for review! Yep, I'll update patch - double check checkstyle, license header,annotations, rename and this return. Missed that.
stack in fact, this patch contains changes for removal HCM, so once that other patch is committed I'll re-export this one and do the other changes mentioned above.

Here's updated patch incorporating comments above, except for HTableInterface (changing it to use Table instead requires modification of HConnection interface, which is whole different story..This class is deprecated, to..may be removed too? )
stack do you prefer it on review board?

Tests failures seems to be misreported; if I follow link it says: 0 failures (±0) , 25 skipped (±0)?
Long lines and checkstyle came from original code moved to new file.

Retry.

No need of RB unless you changed stuff in the implementation? If you just moved CI out of HCM, then no prob.

Patch looks good.

I just moved CI out of HCM + related renamed everywhere in affected places.

You reattached the same patch, I assume, to kick hadoop-qa, or there're some changes?

Thanks.
